page.title: 02Introduction to Land Cover
page.content: This area is in the heart of rural North Northumberland. The land is predominantly cultivated and the generally rich soils are a bonus for the farming community. Apart from the village of Belford, central to the area, there are only a number of farms providing housing for a limited number of farm workers. The land is relatively flat to the North-East, East and South-East of the village but rises quite steeply to the South-West and directly to the North. The undulating land is punctuated by a few rocky crags and outcrops that form part of the more widespread Whinstone Ridge. There is a small amount of woodland which has mainly been planted as protection for the farms although some has been developed by the Forestry Commission.
